CatDescriptText: William A. Harris, barbershop owner, 7101 Apple Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Out column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 20, 1958, pg. A2 with question: "What is your opinion of bowling? Do you think that it is good recreation for both individuals and families?  Should it be encouraged?"  Answer reads: "Bowling, in my opinion, is good recreation.  It is good for the mind, body and everything else.  I used to bowl but haven't been able to do so lately."
TitMainTitle: William "Woogie" Harris wearing cap standing on street
